ast.name: live
ast.comment: Allows to create requests against the Microsoft Live Connect APIs.

body.text: This library provides the building blocks to do Live API requests (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/live/ ).
## Registering a Live app
Before you get started, you will need to create a Live app (if you have not done so). Start from here:
* https://manage.dev.live.com/?mkt=en-us
Once you've created your Live app, go to `API Settings` tab and enter the following as the `Redirect domain`:
* https://[appid]-{var:userid}-users.touchdevelop.com/{var:userid}/oath
where `[appid]` should be replaced with a unique identifier for this particular app. Live enforces one domain per application.
While you're at it, make sure `Mobile client app` in this tab is set to *No*.
## Authentication

Grab your Client ID and pass it to the `authenticate` action. Do not worry about leaking this id; it is designed to be public. The second argument to `authenticate` is the list of scopes (permissions), see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/live/hh243646.aspx
## Creating requests
You can use the `create request` action to craft more specialized requests against the Live API. See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/live/hh243648.aspx
The library will append the access token as needed; and will refresh the token if necessary.
Once you have the request object, you can set the additional parameters and send it away!
Authenticates the user with the given application and scopes (comma-separated)
Creates a Live SDK request with the given object path and additional query arguments. Authenticates the user if needed. Returns invalid if authentication failed.
Sends the Live SDK request and tries to handle gracefully errors.
Shares the message on the current user. Requires `wl.share` scope.
Shares the text on the current user. Requires `wl.share` scope.
Shares the link on the current user. Requires `wl.share` scope.

xNQ4QkU2iDDFOO1DxKwsriq5.text: where `[redirectdomainid]` should be replaced with a unique identifier for this particular app (must have between 1 and 64 lower case alpha-numeric characters). Live enforces one domain per application so make sure to use a unique domain per application.

VwnyMxgCTNhPgbAWSiXiOrEg.text: Pass your `Client ID` (NOT the secret) and the `redirect domain id` to the `authenticate` action. Do not worry about leaking this client id; it is designed to be public. The third argument to `authenticate` is the list of scopes (permissions), see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/live/hh243646.aspx

HPGc1o868wSHTgvqRzXyVbud.text: You can post text or pictures through the `post text` action. This operation requires the `wl.share` permissions.

KckmF2f5dA8gB82DzkX9NIKb.text: Authentication happens automatically on demand. You can explicitly authenticate the user using `authenticate`.

WnIm8gWeM30ueVZmRebfCG3U.text: Initializes the application information. `scope` is a comma-separated list of permissions used by this application.

app.comment: Allows to build Microsoft Live Connect apps. #docs #live #OAuthv2
Allows to build Microsoft Live Connect apps. #live #OAuthv2

JNOglx1FxiRvVY151ABnT2sT.text: You can retreive the current or any other user information using `code->user`.

NeRySsFh7b4VDzIeqsq2Cdy7.text: Queries the information about a user. Leave blank to get the current user.
